result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amber Dawn Locke

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Amber Dawn Locke appeared by video.  Attorney Haley E Wentz appeared by video for Amber Dawn Locke.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference held. Parties are pursuing a DPA hearing, defendant needs to complete TAD evaluation. Case is adjourned in Branch 30.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant NO VIOLENT CONTACT with JMC.

Defendant Amber Dawn Locke in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amber Dawn Locke appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Case in court for pretrial conference. Defense counsel has not received discovery and an offer from the state.  Defense requests status date to determine case posture. Defense request to be heard as to a bail modification on the no contact order.  Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court. Case adjourned to Branch 30.  Status conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JMC.

Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 30 for a Pretrial Conference.

Defendant Amber Dawn Locke in court.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Amber Dawn Locke not in court.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 6-22-2022 @2p
